# Introduction
  
Testing CellMixS batch effect metrics

In these test synthetic datasets, there is no cell type-specific signal, so we'll simulate those using 
splatter https://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/vignettes/splatter/inst/doc/splatter.html

Prepare extreme heterogeneous datasets (batch effects + different subtype composition) to evaluate metrics

```{r}

simulateAndMeasure <- function(ncellsTotal,freqBatch1,de.facLoc=0.2, de.facScale=0.2, batch.facScale=0, batch.facLoc=0, mySeed=123){
  
ncellsBatch1 <- freqBatch1*ncellsTotal
ncellsBatch2 <- (ncellsTotal-ncellsBatch1)/2

set.seed(mySeed)

test <- splatSimulate(batchCells = c(ncellsBatch1, ncellsBatch2*2, ncellsBatch2*2), group.prob = c(0.5, 0.5), 
                            method = "groups", verbose = FALSE, de.facLoc=de.facLoc, de.facScale=de.facScale, batch.facScale= batch.facScale, batch.facLoc=batch.facLoc ) # see ?SplatParams  de.facLoc=0.2, de.facScale=0.2

test <- test[,!(test$Batch=="Batch2" & test$Group=="Group1")]
test <-  test[,!(test$Batch=="Batch3" & test$Group=="Group2")]
print(table(test$Group,test$Batch))
test <- logNormCounts(test)
test <- runPCA(test, ncomponents = 2, ntop=500)
test <- evalIntegration(test, metrics = c("isi", "cms","mixingMetric","entropy"), group = "Batch", k = 20, n_dim = 2, cell_min = 5, weight = F)

return(test)
}

```


```{r}
plotSimul <- function(test){
plotPCA(test, shape_by = "Group", colour_by = "Batch") + ggtitle(sprintf("cms %.2f; lisi %.2f; mixingMetric %.2f; entropy %.2f",mean(test$cms_smooth),mean(test$isi),mean(test$mm),mean(test$entropy))) | plotPCA(test, shape_by = "Batch", colour_by = "Group")
}

```

```{r}
test.list <- list()
test.list[["batchStrong_balanced"]] <- simulateAndMeasure(ncellsTotal = 1000,freqBatch1 = .33, batch.facScale = 0.1, batch.facLoc = 0.1)
plotSimul(test.list[["batchStrong_balanced"]])
```
